detaileddescription.para: Storage type for a part of a path access. Basically this is the name of a file or directory.
Storage type for the filesystem access parts this is basically a list/of/elements/in/a/path.
Nullary constructor, pls don't use. It only exists because Cython can't RAII. It should be just friend of cython.
Construct a path object from a python fslike object. This is called from Cython.
You will probably never call that manually.
Construct a path from a fslike pointer.
Resolve the native path by flattening all underlying filesystem objects (like unions). Returns the /native/path/on/disk. Throws up if there is no native path.
This basically is the same as resolve_*().get_native_path().
Return the native path (something like /your/folder/with/file) for this path. returns emptystring ("") if there is no native path.
This does not minimize/flatten (= "resolve") the path!
You probably want to use resolve_native_path instead.
C++ pendant to the python util.fslike.path.Path
Contains a filesystem-like object and path-parts.
pxd: cppclass Path: ctypedef string part_t ctypedef vector[string] parts_t
Path() noexcept Path(PyObj, const vector[string]&) except +
